Dear Ms. Carey:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 02/24/2020.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and
Implementation Settlement Exit Plan (ISEP) requirements, a written corrective action plan
is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of
the ISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12212 Personnel records.
(3) The personnel record shall contain both of the following:
(a) A written evaluation of a staff member's performance
within a probationary period or not later than 6 months after the
staff member assumes his or her current responsibilities. After
the initial evaluation, a written evaluation shall be conducted
each year.
One of six employee files reviewed does not have the required
performance evaluation. The missing performance evaluation is
a recently hired employee’s 6-month probationary evaluation.
REPEAT VIOLATION from 03/28/2019 renewal inspection
Corrective action plan approved 04/04/2019
R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following information
and documentation, which shall be recorded within 30 calendar
days after placement in independent living and updated at least
once every 90 calendar days:
(o) Service plans as required in R 400.12419 and R 400.12420.
Three of six updated service plans reviewed are not completed
within 90 calendar days from the previous service plan.
Service plan 04/27/2019 to 07/25/2019 completed 08/08/2019
Service plan 07/26/2019 to 10/23/2019 completed 10/31/2019
Service plan 10/24/2019 to 01/21/2019 completed 02/01/2020
One of seven service plans reviewed is not approved by the
social service supervisor within 14 days of the social service
worker’s submission of the service plan.
Service plan 02/21/2019 to 09/18/2019 approved 10/21/2019
REPEAT VIOLATION from 03/28/2019 renewal inspection
Corrective action plan approved 04/04/2019

2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
 ISEP 6.33 Service Plan Signatures – Service plans shall be signed by the
case worker, caseworker supervisor, parent(s) and children.
Three of seven service plans reviewed are not signed by the resident.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
 DHHS IL+ Contract - Every 90 days the resident shall be evaluated using
the Ansell Casey Living Skills Assessment to determine continued eligibility,
suitability for placement.
One of seven quarterly service periods reviewed does not have the required
Ansell Casey Living Skills Assessment. It is either not uploaded into
MiSACWIS or not completed as required.
 DHHS Policy FOM 801 Medical Passport
Seven of seven medical passports reviewed are not signed and dated by
the case worker or resident.
REPEAT VIOLATION from 03/28/2019 renewal inspection
Corrective action plan approved 04/04/2019

The facility was offered consultation in the following areas: None at this time.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There are no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Spectrum Child and Family Services Independent Living submitted one acceptable
corrective action plan not related to maltreatment during this licensing period. The
corrective action plan is from their 03/28/2019 renewal inspection. Compliance is
met except for the repeat violations identified in this inspection report.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
